title: Drawing, "Design for a Woven Hanging "Hummingbirdcages" (recto); Design for Multi-paneled Wall Hanging (verso)", 1964
medium: Crayon and graphite on white wove paper
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite in margin, upper right:  Hummingbird cages. 1964; in margin, lower left:  28 x 41 (partially cut off and written over other partially erased numbers); in margin, lower center:  28 wide/41 long; in margins along right and lower edges:  numbers marking scale;  in green crayon lower right:  ...single... (rest of inscription partially rubbed off)
creditline: Gift of Mr. Eric and Mrs. Sylvia Elsesser, The Trude Guermonprez Archives
description: Recto:  Sketch of abstract design with asymmetrically placed rectangular and square boxes within upright rectangular frame.  Two boxes (upper right and left center) have figural pictographs; the box at lower right corner may depict three birds on a branch.  The drawing is squared in graphite.  Punched holes along right edge of support.  Verso:  Design for multi-paneled hanging in situ with pine tree in two left panels.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Woven Hanging "Hummingbirdcages" (recto); Design for Multi-paneled Wall Hanging (verso)", 1964.
1964. Crayon and graphite on white wove paper. Gift of Mr. Eric and Mrs. Sylvia Elsesser, The Trude Guermonprez Archives. 1993-121-69.
